bwwExcerpt: Like its spiritual grandchild The Normal Heart, Ibsen’s drama scores hard points against real social ills while also suggesting that a passionate crusader, frozen in the spotlight of his truth, can sometimes be his own worst enemy. Adam Markavitz, Entertainment Weekly: Never mind that it takes place in 19th-century Norway.
